column2: A local newspaper has published an annoucement claiming that a local man has found a small vein of gold in the region. Now, people are coming from all over in their own search for gold!
A number of small local mines have opened up in search for gold. They have had some success, but their overall success will be told with time.
Unfortunately, the mines in $PROVINCENAME$ have dried up.
The mines in $PROVINCENAME$ have started to boom. In fact, when someone mentions the region, it is rare that they do not talk about our gold mines.
A prospector has recently discovered a rather large vein of anthricite, and has taken advantage of being the first one to the prize. They have opened up a new mine, which is booming in size.

Our mine in Dublin has collapsed. Luckily, only a handful of men were effected. However, it would take years to rebuilt it and start turning a profit, and have yet to find an investor willing to take the risk.
